intro: Myrsine rufescens, commonly known as red-fruited myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species. Myrsine rufescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
